oai_dc:dc.dc:title: First Mothers' Club
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Clubs; Mothers; Organizations
oai_dc:dc.dc:description:
The Christian Brothers College Mothers' Club was formed in 1929.
Over the years, the organization sponsored social and cultural activities. In addition they generated considerable money for the school, funding seating in the Gymnasium, purchasing the Union Railroad's right of way, and building the Bell Tower.
